text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm and welcome to another installment
of cooking with grass-fed beef today
we're doing New York strips really
delicious easy piece of meat to cook I'm
using meat from Steve noir meetin at
Normanton farms and I'm doing it with a
warm caramelized mushroom salad I love
this steak recipe the meatiness of the
caramelized mushrooms really brings out
the best flavors in this grass-fed meat
all right so first we're going to prep
our mushrooms I have 8 large mushrooms
you can use white Brown anything you
want to cut off the dark little part of
the stem there you can you can leave it
on doesn't really matter we're going to
make some fairly thick slices so there's
my sliced mushrooms and a heavy bottomed
saute pan I have some olive oil and
butter and of course all the amounts
will be on the site for you and over
medium heat you're going to bring that
butter up till it foams and when the top
of the foam the foam is part of the foam
it's a little bit of a nutty hue you're
going to throw in your mushrooms so what
we're going to do is we're going to
slowly caramelize these it's going to
take a while I'm warning you give it a
nice big pinch of salt you're going to
saute these and you're going to see over
the course of about probably 20 minutes
you're going to see the liquids going to
come out of them there's going to be
significant shrinkage you're going to
really concentrate all those mushroom
flavors now when you give them a stir be
sure to even them out so that they're
all touching the pan because if they're
sitting on top of each other then they
won't get evenly caramelized ok so once
you give mister Jersey them back out
like that now when they get nice and
browned okay again you got to take your
time here we're not in a hurry when they
look like that when they're all kind of
brown and getting a little bit you know
Chris penis around the edges then
they're ready so we're going to do to
finish the caramelized mushroom salad
I'm going to pound one garlic clove you
don't need to chop it just really smash
it and what happens when we toss it in a
bowl with those hot buttery oily
mushrooms the garlic clove is going to
kind of perfume the mushrooms and it's
going to absorb that flavor it's going
to be beautiful
alright the pans off but it's still very
hot I'm going to add my sherry vinegar
you can also do this with balsamic
really nice scrape off any of this stuff
at the bottom of the pan yes that's
called deglaze and we're going to pour
that over our mushrooms give that a toss
and just let that sit so really easy
really simple really delicious mushroom
salad and we're going to finish that in
the pan later alright our New York
strips have thawed slowly in the
refrigerator alright those two steaks
are about 8 ounces each we're going to
Pat those dry give them a generous
seasoning with salt and pepper on both
sides all right so I have a hot pan with
a little bit of olive oil and I'm going
to sear these for me I went about 2 and
1/2 minutes per side I like it rare
medium rare when I'm cooking grass-fed
beef I think that really is the best for
the texture of a grass-fed piece of meat
especially a New York Strip ok if you
want to cook yours longer go ahead but
you're risking drying it out a little
bit and you'll see we're going to nice
little caramelized fond at the bottom of
the pan those caramelized meat juices so
two and a half minutes per side for me I
pulled them off you got to let it rest
very important I'm going to throw a
chunk of butter in and my mushroom salad
right on top of that caramelized pan
drippings any of the liquid from the
steak any of the liquid from the
mushrooms gets poured in there give that
a stir and with a spoon just make sure
you scrape up the bottom that liquid
will do glaze release all those
delicious caramelized bits go ahead and
turn off the heat finish with some
chopped fresh tarragon that is what
really explodes this dish alright my
steaks have rested I'm going to put my
mushroom salad over my grass-fed New
York Strip grass-fed beef for this cut
alright for a New York Strip rare to
medium-rare is really going to give you
the the optimum flavor and texture in my
opinion ok so you see it's nice and pink
there it's okay to eat pink meat don't
be a scared delicious and that is just a
really easy simple New York Strip recipe
and what a great combination that juicy
mild flavored meat with those really
earthy caramelized mushrooms the little
bit of sweetness from the tarragon that
little hint of garlic black pepper on
the steak just everything works so
perfectly together
the vinegar and the marinade the perfect
amount of acidity love this recipe
anyway I hope you give that a try all
the ingredients are on the site so check
it out and as always enjoy
